title: got put in unfair 20 minute low priority queue.
body: So yesterday i got on league on my laptop, after i waited 5 mins to finally get a match when i got in the match the game crashed, i sent a crash report in, i tried to reconnect, it crashed again, i sent in 3 crash reports and tried reconnecting 4 different times but it still crashed, so as a normal human would do, i gave up and stopped trying. i get on my desktop today thinking "oh this is going to be much better then my stupid laptop." turns out i'm in a low 20 min queue, unfairly of course. can anyone tell me how i can get out of the queue without spending hours finding matches to get back to a normal queue.

replies.body:
There's no way to work down a *low-priority queue* other than playing the matches. Regardless of intentions, your absence negatively affects everyone in the match. This is a big reason as to why disconnections are all treated equally by the system and why we're unable to remove penalties associated with the [**Leaverbuster System.**](https://support.riotgames.com/hc/en-us/articles/201752714-LeaverBuster-FAQ)

It sounds like you experienced some bugsplats with your laptop. We often see these happen if something is wrong with your drivers or hardware. Our [**Bugsplat Guide**](https://support.riotgames.com/hc/en-us/articles/201761974-Bug-Splat-and-Game-Crashes) will walk you through the most common solutions, so I recommend giving those steps a try and testing changes in a custom match to avoid further penalties.

Let me know if you have any questions.
